head.title: UTMB®

meta.content:
UTMB® - World summit of trail-running
from August 24th to August 30th 2020

UTMB® - World summit of trail-running
from August 24th to August 30th 2020
meta.name: description

meta.content: ultra trail du Mont Blanc, ultra-trail, tour du Mont-Blanc, Chamonix, Courmayeur, Champex, UTMB, CCC, TDS, PTL, OCC
meta.name: keywords

div.p: A qualifying race is a race which allows, according to its difficulty, the acquisition of between 1 and 6 qualification points.

Only trail races can be qualifying races
. For the definition of a trail race:
click here
.

Road races, triathlons, multi-sport races and orienteering races are not subjects of qualifying races for the UTMB
®
.

The evaluation of the races, and therefore the distribution of points, is managed by the ITRA (International Trail Running Association). The UTMB
®
, on the basis of the number of points attributed by the ITRA, however are alone in judging whether a race presents all the criteria to be a qualifying race, to register it on the list and to award the organiser with the corresponding logo.

input.value: How many points do I have?

div.h2: Number of points necessary for the 2021 registration
div.p:
Each race included in this list has been attributed with from 1 to 6 points.
In order to register, it is necessary to have gained the required number of points by finishing,
between 01/01/2019 and 31/12/2020 exclusively
(*), any of the races included in this list:

ul.li:
To register for the UTMB
®
, it is necessary to have a minimum of 10 points from a maximum of 2 races.

To register for the TDS
®
, it is necessary to have a minimum of 8 points in 1 or 2 races.

To register for the CCC
®
, it is necessary to have a minimum of 6 points in 1 or 2 races.
To register for the OCC, it is necessary to have a minimum of 4 points in 1 or 2 races.

div.p:
(*) 2018 finishers of the UTMB
®
races may equally use these races as qualifying races.

p.strong: If you have abandoned during a race, there is no way that this race can be taken in to account.

strong.span:
It will not be possible to register for the 2021 UTMB
®
, CCC
®
, TDS
®
or OCC
by making reference to a race not included in this list.

div.p: The only qualifying list, available for consultation is on our web-site, is valid. The Organisation is not responsible for inaccurate, obsolete or untruthful information supplied by people foreign to the Organisation.

The Organisation equally is not responsible in the case of the absence of a race in the list of qualifying races. It is up to each organiser, who so wishes, to request accreditation as a qualifying race for the UTMB
®
. Runners who would like a race to be a qualifying race for the UTMB
®
must make the request with the organisers of that race.

All the qualifying races used by runners to finalise their registration are verified, against the official race results.
The Organisation takes in to account each individual’s result (relay or team event included).
The runner must be sure that they appear in the official results for the stated race, and that their first and surnames have the correct spelling.
In the case of an inexact declaration of qualifying races, not conforming to the regulations or untrue, the organisation reserves the right to cancel the registration without refunding fees paid and to remove their advantage for the following year in the case of a negative draw.
Our engagement as organiser is to apply this regulation in a rigorous and identical manner for, without exception, ALL runners and therefore we do not accept any requests for exceptions to this rule.

strong.span: 2021 registrations: Only the 2019 and 2020 qualifying races can count for the 2021 races

p.span:
The list of qualifying races is updated as when and when organisers submit their races.
If a race or event in which you have competed, or are going to compete, is not on the list, we suggest that you contact the organisers of this race to discover whether they have already requested to be included.
N.B.
: the addition of a race from one year to the next is not automatic, this means that if a race was on the list of qualifying races in 2019 it will not necessarily be on the list for 2020. Contact the race organiser to check that they have applied to be on the current list.
